description: The end-to-end set of business processes for receiving and processing customer orders for goods or services and collecting payment.

stages.description: Handling initial customer interest, providing information, and generating quotes or proposals.
Capturing customer orders, validating order details, checking credit, and confirming product/service availability.
Picking, packing, and dispatching goods, or provisioning services as per the order.
Generating and sending accurate invoices to customers based on fulfilled orders or services rendered.
Receiving customer payments, managing accounts receivable, applying payments to invoices, and handling discrepancies.
Handling customer returns, managing claims or disputes related to orders or invoices.

description: The end-to-end process of obtaining and managing the raw materials, goods, and services needed to manufacture a product or operate a business, through to payment.

stages.description: Identifying the need for goods or services and creating a purchase requisition.
Selecting suppliers (often through RFx processes), negotiating terms, and issuing a formal Purchase Order (PO).
Receiving delivered goods or confirming service completion, and inspecting for quality and quantity against the PO.
Receiving supplier invoices, validating them against POs and goods receipts (3-way match), and resolving discrepancies.
Processing payments to suppliers according to agreed terms and reconciling accounts payable.
Ongoing management and performance evaluation of suppliers.

description: The complete journey of an employee within an organization, from recruitment and onboarding through their tenure, development, and eventual separation.

stages.description: Attracting, sourcing, screening, interviewing, and selecting candidates for open positions.
Integrating new hires into the organization, including paperwork, system access, orientation, and initial training.
Setting goals, evaluating performance, providing feedback, identifying development needs, and offering training/growth opportunities.
Managing salaries, bonuses, benefits enrollment, payroll processing, and leave management.
Fostering a positive work environment, managing employee relations, and handling grievances.
Managing the process of an employee leaving the organization, including exit interviews, final settlements, and de-provisioning access.

description: The process of collecting, processing, and presenting financial data to provide internal and external stakeholders with accurate financial statements and reports.
typicalIndustries: All industries, especially publicly traded companies

stages.description: Capturing all financial transactions (e.g., sales, purchases, journal entries) accurately and completely in the general ledger and sub-ledgers.
Performing month-end, quarter-end, and year-end closing procedures, including accruals, reconciliations, and intercompany eliminations. Consolidating financial data from various entities.
Preparing financial statements (Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Cash Flow Statement), management reports, variance analysis, and regulatory filings.
Developing financial budgets, forecasts, and scenarios based on historical data and business plans.
Supporting internal and external audits, ensuring compliance with accounting standards (e.g., IFRS, GAAP) and regulatory requirements.

lifecycleName: Idea to Market / New Product Development (NPD)
description: The complete process of conceiving, designing, developing, testing, and launching new products or services.

stages.description: Generating and screening new ideas based on market research, customer needs, and technological opportunities.
Assessing the technical feasibility, market potential, and financial viability of promising concepts. Developing a business case.
Detailed design of the product/service, engineering, prototyping, and development of manufacturing processes.
Testing prototypes, conducting pilot runs, gathering user feedback, and validating that the product/service meets requirements and quality standards.
Developing marketing and sales plans, ramping up production, launching the product/service to the market, and managing initial sales.
Monitoring market performance, gathering customer feedback post-launch, and managing the product through its lifecycle (updates, enhancements, end-of-life).

description: The overall process of managing interactions and relationships with current and potential customers to drive sales, improve customer service, and increase retention.

stages.description: Identifying and attracting potential customers through various marketing channels and campaigns.
Engaging with leads, providing relevant information, and qualifying them based on interest and fit.
Managing the sales pipeline, pursuing opportunities, negotiating deals, and closing sales.
Successfully onboarding new customers and ensuring smooth delivery of products/services.
Providing ongoing support, addressing customer inquiries, and resolving issues effectively.
Engaging existing customers, fostering loyalty, encouraging repeat business, and managing advocacy programs.

description: The core day-to-day processes involved in producing goods or delivering services, managing resources, and ensuring operational performance.

stages.description: Forecasting demand, planning production/service capacity, and scheduling resources (materials, labor, equipment).
The actual process of manufacturing goods or delivering services according to plans and quality standards.
Managing raw materials, work-in-progress (WIP), and finished goods inventory levels, including storage, movement, and replenishment.
Monitoring and ensuring that products or services meet defined quality standards through inspections, testing, and process controls.
Maintaining equipment, facilities, and other assets to ensure operational readiness and minimize downtime.
Managing the storage, transportation, and delivery of finished goods to customers or distribution centers (overlaps with O2C fulfillment).
Tracking key operational metrics, analyzing performance, identifying bottlenecks, and reporting on efficiency and effectiveness.
